meanings.definition: The quality or state of being momentary.
meanings.sent1: The momentariness of the fireworks display left everyone in awe.
meanings.sent2: I was struck by the momentariness of the shooting star streaking across the sky.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about the momentariness of his fame, saying it was shorter than a sneeze.
meanings.sent4: The artist captured the momentariness of life in her painting, showing fleeting moments frozen in time.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the sunset reminded me of the momentariness of each passing day.

meanings.sent1: The momentariness of the rain shower was refreshing on a hot day.
meanings.sent2: She marveled at the momentariness of childhood, realizing how quickly it passed.
meanings.sent3: The momentariness of the traffic jam was a welcome relief for the commuters.
meanings.sent4: In the blink of an eye, the momentariness of the sunrise painted the sky with vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The momentariness of the music performance left the audience wanting more.
